topic: Beat Procrastination with Commitments: Implementation Intentions and Self-Imposed Deadlines
target_audience: students who struggle to start or finish tasks on time

refs.content: If–then planning increases goal attainment by automating cue–response links; strong evidence across domains.
Self-imposed deadlines can improve performance, though not optimally; commitment devices counter present bias.
Self-control predicts academic outcomes; structures and precommitment reduce demands on willpower.

special_instructions: Give a plug-and-play plan: define trigger cues, set public mini-deadlines, use calendar holds, create friction for distractions.
